title: Lebanon’s Prime Minister-Designate Saad Hariri Resigns After Failing to Form Government
sub_head: Country’s political crisis deepens as Hariri says he couldn’t reach agreement with president
body:
BEIRUT—Lebanon’s prime minister-designate Saad Hariri on Thursday abandoned his nine-month effort to form a government, deepening a political crisis as the country struggles with a cratering economy and medical shortages amid a global pandemic.
President Michel Aoun tasked Mr. Hariri in October with forming a new government after the last one collapsed in the aftermath of the deadly Beirut explosion in August that destroyed much of the capital. Mr. Hariri is the second prime minister-designate to give up trying to form up a government amid a deadlock among the country’s ruling elite.
“May God save the country,” Mr. Hariri said as he announced his resignation following a meeting with the president.
Mr. Hariri said his resignation was the result of not being able to agree with Mr. Aoun, Lebanon’s octogenarian president who controls the largest Christian bloc in Parliament.
The prime minister-designate and president had sparred over the allocation of portfolios in the cabinet, according to Mr. Hariri’s media adviser. The president in a statement shared on Twitter said Mr. Hariri wasn’t willing to discuss amendments to his proposals.
